Method Detail

getChannel

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getChannel(java.lang.String clientId)

generateTvCode

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response generateTvCode(Channel channel)
Creates a random integer <= 1000 to use as a temporary TV Code. This code is displayed on the TV, then typed into a controller device by the user in order to join the controller to the TV.

Parameters:
channel - If the tv is already connected to a channel, this will contain that information. If an existing channel was sent in, it will need to be updated in the datastore with the new tvCode If the channel is null, then we need to create a new channel and persist it in the datastore, as well as return that info in the response.
Returns:
A Channel object, containing a one- to four digit integer in the tvCode attribute. The rest of the Channel object will also be populated, either from the channel that was sent in on the request, or from the channel that was created.

subscribe

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response subscribe()
Creates a channel using its own server-generated UUID as the client id.

A random UUID is generated and then persisted to the datastore before calling the overloaded subscribe(clientId) method.

Returns:
Response object
See Also:
subscribe(String)

subscribe

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response subscribe(java.lang.String clientId)
Creates a channel when the client id is already known. The client id could have come from a browser cookie, or it could have been generated by the other subscribe() method on this resource.

Parameters:
clientId - The client id for the new channel
Returns:
a Channel JSON object

joinTV

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response joinTV(int tvCode)
Uses the TV Code to join a controller to a TV.

Parameters:
tvCode - The TV Code that was generated and displayed on the TV, then typed into the controller and sent here.
